definition: lit. a brick as a door knocker (idiom); fig. a temporary expedient/to use sb as a stepping stone to fortune
to hit/to strike/to tap/to rap/to knock/to rip sb off/to overcharge

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

sentences.english: Nowadays, educational qualifications and professional competence credentials are the stepping-stone(passport) to get a good job .
sentences.chinese: 现如今学历和专业技能证书是找到好工作的敲门砖。

sentences.english: Addresses play a rule of stepping stone in social communications.
sentences.chinese: 社会交往中，称谓词扮演着敲门砖的作用。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, Young people see cosmetic surgery as the key to wealth and love."They
sentences.chinese: 同时，年轻人把整容看作是财富与爱情的敲门砖。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, Young people see cosmetic surgery as the key to wealth and love.
sentences.chinese: 同时，年轻人把整容看作是财富与爱情的敲门砖。

sentences.english: Idleness is the key of beggary , and the root of all evil.
sentences.chinese: 懒惰是行乞的敲门砖，是万恶的根源。

sentences.english: And you think gramma's story is your ticket?
sentences.chinese: 你认为我奶奶的故事是你的敲门砖？

sentences.english: It is also a key to any business program.
sentences.chinese: 也是任何商业程序的敲门砖。

sentences.english: He seems to think that wealth is the open sesame to happiness.
sentences.chinese: 他似认为财富是快乐的敲门砖。

sentences.english: Now, we have realized that Elsevier's gentleness is only one time discount for the first time meet.
sentences.chinese: 现在看来，这些只是一份见面礼，一块敲门砖。

sentences.english: A gift is a gift, not the beginning of a transaction.
sentences.chinese: 礼物就是单纯的礼物，不会是一场交易的敲门砖。

sentences.english: A good degree can be an open sesame to a good job.
sentences.chinese: 好学历是好工作的敲门砖。

definition: stepping stone/fig. person used to advance one's career
touchstone/fig. test that sth is genuine
(slang) to rely on one's father's wealth or prestige to get ahead
settle down and get on with one's pursuit
hard power (i.e. military and economic power)
lit. Mt Zhongnan is a shortcut to a ministerial job (idiom); fig. to take a shortcut to promotion
stumbling block/obstacle/someone who gets in your way
